page.title: 01Our Area
page.content: The area that we have been given to study is rural.We went to a good vantage point and could see fields interspersed with woods and farmland.They looked like a patchwork quilt.There are two landmarks that really show up,the sand and gravel quarry and Marley Tiles. The two biggest woods are The Heugh Wood and Milkwell Burn Wood having mostly deciduos trees in both. The main tourist attraction is the Derwent Walk, an old railway which has been made into a walkway. In the area there are ten farms, five churches and three schools.
